name: cashprizes
text: what? no comments? what about how great tofutti-cuties are, or ray's smart hat?

name: fishingblues
text: or the fact that the Subaru Brat is referenced.  legit

name: suprememongoose
text: Seconded

name: deimosrising
text: It's just...it's such a good hat. It's a really good hat to have on.

name: tim_simmons
text: a hell good hat yes

name: tekende
text: Or just generally around.

name: snowman
text: It is a perfect...hat!

name: shutup_shutup
text: The perfect hat to wear, ever!

name: canusdivinus
text: No other hat could be worn to die in by such a cat as Ray.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: It is an IDIOT HAT for anyone but Max von Sydow.

name: snoozebar
text:
I saw an old, beat up Subaru Brat several months ago! License plate was 'FURRY'. There was a dog paw print medallion hanging from the mirror, and some dorky-ass guy driving it, so it was indeed *that* kind of furry.

I thought of this very strip, and it got just a little more appropriate.

name: cousinted
text: It truly is a hell car.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: I used to tour guide at Johnson Space Center in Houston.  There was always a Subaru Brat parked right outside the building with the giant Space Shuttle mock-ups they use to train astronauts.  NASA's feng shui is screwed.

name: tellumo
text: The Subaru Brat is generally recognized as the worst possible feng shui object.

name: snowman
text: Elderly Chinese people everywhere agree.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Assetbar Comment Generator Online

...generating...

"They're all like, 'CHING CHONG WING WONG'"

Comoment generated successfully in 0.08 seconds

name: semiquaver
text: It's painful, and it's true.

name: aperson
text: Is perhaps most basic cliche response.

name: semiquaver
text: It's painful, and it's true.

name: wfl
text:
You forgot to make the *press* noise.


..

*preesssssss*

name: rykan
text: Good call, sir.

name: fattypneumonia
text: "Comoment" gets teh chubby.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Oh, I'll put you in a como alright

name: fattypneumonia
text:
Oye, Como va.

[IMGS OFF]

name: tekende
text:
I saw an old Subaru
And when it came near
I saw the license plate said "FURRY" and it had a dog paw print medallion on the mirror
If anything I can say that this Brat was rare
But I thought Nah forget it
Yo homes to Bel Air

name: saint
text: ray is all "hell no." and then he and the gate keeper burst out laughing at the irony.

name: chaesar
text: You can't call bullshit in Hell. Hell is where eternity calls bullshit on you.

name: epicurus
text: I like that saying, I think that needs to be in the next build of the Bible.

name: eric
text: It should be right next to a quail screaming "Don't eat mee!"

name: goddessdictator
text: Also, you can summarize the whole Bible with "Bitch please, God knows best."

name: spinynorman
text: Man, chaesar, that comment is like Yakov Smirnov meets Sartre or something

name: sugadiabeetus
text: This comment has 69 chubbies. I like that.

name: ssddr
text: He just skips the whole storyline and drop us into the aftermath. Great

name: luckypyjamas
text: yeah, a little more on the last story would have been nice

name: boredom_man
text: Perhaps a few years of Philippe going through therapy. The inevitable acting out as a teen, and his defiance of the suburban values which failed to protect him.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
oh man okay, we already covered that in another comic

i remember

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray looks like he prepared for Hell by packing some belongings and donning a responsible hat.

name: rowboat
text: He obviously has mistaken hell for the Swiss Alps.

name: tellumo
text: I think that may be his vegan hat. Ray is just the sort to think that veganism means you need a hat.

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by DR_MANFLESH_DESIRES_ANAL_PLAY_IMMEDIATELY, yingkaixing, mattylite)

name: zedpower
text:
Oh man it's like Planet 'a the Apes but insteadda the Statue of Liberty it's a big metal fourth wall stickin' outta the sand
It's so... it's so frikkin' sweet
It's so... important

name: natemeister
text: if he's in hell, there should be a TV mounted to that wall playing Wheel of Fortune, and muzak speakers playing "Late December 1963". then it would be hell.

name: cdl146
text: I love the way Achewood treats death as a temporary inconvenience.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Not this time, man. A 1982 Subaru Brat is serious .

name: ezcmac
text: Even death is just a momentary diversion on the road to the grave... somehow.

name: slab64
text: The road from the grave?

name: purplehaze
text: This strip is good, but am I the only one thats bothered when Achewood goes out of character into "On the Set of Achewood" mode?

name: goosey
text: It happens less rarely when you re-read them. It was more rare first time round because there was more than thirty seconds between each strip, and that rarity works. Going back over them now, though, it does seem to happen a little too much.

name: rad_chillies
text: I definitely get bothered.  You start to wonder bout all sorts of stuff.  If they're just actors, and Ray getting rich by selling his soul was a 'storyline' then is Ray still the rich playa that we know him as today?  It's the most confusing thing about Achewood to me, but that's when I decide to stop thinking about it so much and just laugh and enjoy those jokes.  What the hell people

name: epicurus
text:
My thoughts exactly. If they are just actors, it is not as good, or at least not the same.

I comfort myself by pretending that the actors are in fact the regular characters PLAYING actors playing themselves! I mean, I don't think Chris Onstad minds too much if I do that.

name: gethen
text: er, does anyone else think of them as doodles with words next to their heads? er, me? no, no i.. i was just asking to see if YOU did.

name: semiquaver
text: Def. stop thinking about it.  This was a time in which Onstad was playing around with the comic being such as a TV show or film...you can see it also in the strip where Paul F. Weisz is credited as the ice cream shop manager.  It is just some fun that the author has in order to move things along.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Agreed. Sorry to sound like a prick, but do all you guys read comic books and actually care about this kind of shit?

These type of strips always remind me of Bloom County, like the strip where the "cast" gets tested for anabolic steroids. Fictional integrity and continuity were not major concerns of mine while reading Bloom County as a kid; I maintain that same outlook when I read Achewood.

name: semiquaver
text: Oh my god.  I've found someone else who doesn't care about the continuity.  Yes!

name: semiquaver
text: Oh my god.  I've found someone else who doesn't care about the continuity.  Yes!

name: tomsonlocal
text: The DVD of this shows Ray's big old dramatic death, it's one of the deleted scene extras.

name: dasilodavi
text: I like this storyline.  Seems odd to jump right into another long series though.

name: nytyper
text: I SO wanted a Subaru Brat in 1982.  I was 14 and didn't know any better.

name: jdhenry105
text: A comment left by jdhenry105 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rowboat, stormagnet, Satyr)

name: cousinted
text:
And down in the ground
is a place where you go
If you've been a bad boy

name: waldo913
text: Maynard James Keenan of TOOL owns and drives a Subaru Brat when he's working in his vineyards in Arizona.  True story.  I don't reckon this was a coincidence.

name: biddlebubbly
text: HAT COMES OUT OF FUCKING NOWHERE

name: luckypyjamas
text: the demon = pat with horns

name: presterjohn
text: This is the Perfect Segue after the last arc.

name: lolsworth
text: Straight out of one arc, into the next, no messing around.

name: c_dizzle
text: ONLY CHOCOLATE Tofutti-Cuties. The vanilla is just soy, damnitall.

name: ovenface
text: why not the keylime pie ones?

name: thorfinn
text: What exactly is a tofutti cutie?

name: c_dizzle
text: soy ice cream sammich. fin.

name: greenkoolayd
text: it is soy, therefore it is not ice cream.  only real people who eat real critters and real critters' real bodily fluids get ice cream.

name: tellumo
text: Oh it's like this vegan ice cream sandwich

name: greenkoolayd
text: it is soy, therefore it is not ice cream.  only real people who eat real critters and real critters' real bodily fluids get ice cream.

name: aparrish
text: It's like an ice cream sandwich, except you get gas even if you're not lactose intolerant.  It doesn't discriminate.

name: gethen
text: Favorite part: Ray's 'big old dramatic death scene' is summed up by SOON

name: ifergott
text: this strip has more clipboards than usual

name: tellumo
text:
Fun fact! The alt text says that "It has the rear-facing seats in the bed STOCK"--but why? Because the tax laws then in effect allowed Subaru to classify the Brat as a passenger car instead of a truck if they welded in the rear seats, and therefore to pay a 2.5% instead of a 25% tariff.

( theme plays )

name: stormagnet
text: I swear the only reason you have no chubbies is that everyone runs out by the end of this page. Like me. Your use of subtle linking over cliched quotation is WIN.

name: the_voice
text: I find it both hilarious and disturbing that Ray is towelling off in the first panel.

name: clockworkorange
text: He is toweling off because he was out in the rain in the previous strip.

name: the_voice
text: Ok, it's kind of incredible that you picked up on that. I'm actually a little disappointed that there is a reason behind the toweling.

name: greatwhite
text: Its just one amazing storyline after another.

name: carlyle
text: First thing I thought about that hat was Alpini, then Italy, then Runescape for some reason...

name: rayonatoilet
text: Seeing a Subaru Brat in real life has an awing effect, much like realizing for the first time that your parents were in love once.

name: atypicaloracle
text: I used to own a Bi-drive Recreational All-terrain Transporter. We called it "The Antichrist."
